Package dslabs.framework

Interface Client

  • public interface Client

    Clients are a special case of Node. Client nodes will have handlers for Messages and Timers like all Nodes but also provide an interface for interactively sending Commands and receiving Results in a system.

    Clients in this framework are "closed-loop" clients. That is, they will only have one outstanding command at any given time. You are free to assume this throughout the labs; the test code always waits for the previous command to return a result before sending the next.

    IMPORTANT: Client interface methods must be properly synchronized with Message handlers and Timer handlers, since the event handlers are invoked concurrently with the code using the client. The easiest way to do this is to add the synchronized modifier to all of the aforementioned methods. Furthermore, hasResult() should return immediately, while getResult() should block until the client has received a result for the latest command it sent.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Result getResult()
      Returns the value from the Result for the previously sent Command.

      void sendCommand​(Command command)
      Send a Command to the system with the given operation.

    • Method Detail

      • sendCommand

        void sendCommand​(Command command)
        Send a Command to the system with the given operation. Should send the Command and return immediately without blocking, sleeping, or starting other threads.
        Parameters:
        command - the Application command to send

      • hasResult

        boolean hasResult()
        Whether or not a Result was received for the previously sent Command. Should return immediately without blocking, sleeping, or starting other threads.
        Returns:
        whether the Result has been received

      • getResult

        Result getResult()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException

        Returns the value from the Result for the previously sent Command. Should block until there is such a Result or the waiting thread is interrupted; this of course means that this method should relinquish all locks/monitors it holds preventing messages from being received while it is waiting. If the calling thread is interrupted while waiting for a Result, an InterruptedException should be thrown. Successive calls to this method (and hasResult()) that are not interrupted and are not interleaved with calls to sendCommand(Command) should continue to return the same value.

        Returns:
        the value corresponding to the previously sent Command
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when the calling thread is interrupted while blocking
